newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Riksbank says crown model is estimate, not target.
newsitem.headline: Riksbank says crown model is estimate, not target.

text.p: The Swedish central bank's fluctuation model for the floating crown currency on the TCW trade-weighted index is an estimate, not a target, Riksbank governor Urban Backstrom said on Friday.
"It is no target interval but an estimate of a balanced rate," Backstrom told journalists after an EMU seminar.
The Riksbank (central bank) has said it expects to see the crown between 108 and 118 on the index. On Friday, it stood at 123.74, a level not seen since October 1995, and up from 122.88 on Thursday.
The crown traded at 4.5690 against the mark, its weakest level since March last year but up from 4.5015 late on Thursday.
"The operative key issue in monetary policy is inflation, and it looks good," Backstrom said. "We have not had such good inflation figures in 30 years."
February consumer prices fell 0.4 percent year-on-year.
The Riksbank targets inflation of 2.0 percent with an allowed deviation of one percentage point above or below that figure.

"We take three factors into account, development of economic trends, inflation expectations and the development of the crown," he said, adding that many fundamentals looked good. -- Barbara Taltavull, Stockholm newsroom +46-8-700 1017
